Package ohos.agp.window.service

Class Display

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.window.service.Display

  • public class Display
extends Object
    Encapsulate display attributes and operations.

    An Display object is returned by DisplayManager.getDefaultDisplay(Context).

    Since:
    2

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int STATE_DOZE
      Indicate that this screen is dozing.
      static int STATE_DOZE_SUSPEND
      Indicate that this screen is dozing, but the CPU suspends updating it.
      static int STATE_OFF
      Indicate that this screen is off.
      static int STATE_ON
      Indicate that this screen is on.
      static int STATE_ON_SUSPEND
      Indicate that this screen is on, but the CPU suspends updating it.
      static int STATE_UNKNOWN
      Indicate that this screen is in an unknown state.
      static int STATE_VR
      Indicate that this screen is in a virtual reality (VR) state.

      Constructor Description
      Display​()
      A constructor used to create a Display instance.

        A constructor used to create a Display instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getDisplayId

        public int getDisplayId​()
        Obtain the ID of a display.
        Returns:
        Return the display ID.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if mDisplayWrapper is null.

      • getDisplayName

        public String getDisplayName​()
        Obtain the name of a display.
        Returns:
        Return the display name.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if mDisplayWrapper is null.

      • getRotation

        public int getRotation​()
        Obtain the rotation degree of a display. The rotation degree is represented by an enumeration value. 0 indicates no rotation, 1 indicates 90 degrees, 2 indicates 180 degrees, and 3 indicates 270 degrees.
        Returns:
        Return the rotation degree of the display.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if mDisplayWrapper is null.

      • getAttributes

        public DisplayAttributes getAttributes​()
        Obtain the Attributes of a display. The width and height of the navigation bar are excluded.
        Returns:
        Return the Attributes of the display.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if mDisplayWrapper is null.

      • getRealAttributes

        public DisplayAttributes getRealAttributes​()
        Obtain the actual Attributes of a display.
        Returns:
        Return the actual Attributes of the display.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if mDisplayWrapper is null.

      • getCurrentSizeRange

        public void getCurrentSizeRange​(Point outSmallestSize,
                                Point outLargestSize)
        Obtain the size range of a display, in unit of pixels.

        This method obtains the maximum and minimum sizes of the display expected in all directions. The obtained display range is stored in the parameters of this method.

        Parameters:
        outSmallestSize - Indicate the minimum display size.
        outLargestSize - Indicate the maximum display size.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if mDisplayWrapper is null.

      • getSize

        public void getSize​(Point outSize)
        Obtain the size of a display.

        This method may not return the actual size of the display. For example, the returned value has excluded the size of the status bar if status bar is always displayed, or the value matches a display that has been scaled for adapting to a small-screen device.

        Parameters:
        outSize - Indicate the display size.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if mDisplayWrapper is null.

      • getRealSize

        public void getRealSize​(Point outSize)
        Obtain the actual display size.

        The returned value includes the size of the status bar, without any scale.

        Parameters:
        outSize - Indicate the actual size of the display.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if mDisplayWrapper is null.

      • getRefreshRate

        public float getRefreshRate​()
        Obtain the screen refresh rate per second of this display device.
        Returns:
        Return the screen refresh rate per second, in Hz.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if mDisplayWrapper is null.
        Since:
        5

      • getDisplayState

        public int getDisplayState​()
        Obtain the state of this display device.
        Returns:
        Return the display device state, which can be STATE_OFF, STATE_ON, STATE_DOZE, STATE_DOZE_SUSPEND, STATE_ON_SUSPEND, or STATE_UNKNOWN.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if mDisplayWrapper is null.
        Since:
        5

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive​()
        Check whether this display device is alive.
        Returns:
        Return true if this display device is alive; returns false if this display device is removed.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if mDisplayWrapper is null.
        Since:
        5
